ratings.comment: The most arbitrary grading I've ever had. The cases are just ones she finds online, but they don't really fit into the class at all, so you have to analyze every WORD to find the answer (and it's still highly unlikely to be HER answer). I would avoid if possible.

Paola is very nice to talk to but the disconnect in in lecture. She tends to use filler words ALOT such as "a". It tends to actually distract me a lot and I counted one day and she averaged saying it 7 times a minute. I feel like she never has a game plan going into class each day and kinda takes it as it goes. Also she is a tough grader.

Paola is honestly not as bad as some people make it out to be. Her exams were not too difficult at all and everything you need to know is either in the PPT slides or the study questions she gives before the exams. Study those and you'll be fine. Cases & group projects are moderately hard, but just follow the prompts & ask questions if you're stuck.

Unsure why Paola gets hate here. I was in a lecture 5 students so maybe she just treated us better? Grading sometimes was a bit unclear, and maybe her lectures could have been more exciting, other than that, solid professor! Just get her to like you by participating and you'll be fine.  Suck it up Bus. students, A's aren't always spoon-fed to us

Absolutely agree with everyone else's comments below. She criticizes students, is a terrible grader and gives pointless, vague projects. It could be an incredibly interesting and meaningful class but she ruins it

Extremely unclear grading practices and takes off for the littlest things. This could be an extremely interesting topic but Paola just makes it so unbearable. Speaks poor english and then criticized a student presentation for speaking poor english.. ridiculous. Group project in this class is the dumbest thing I've ever done.

Class is basically pointless after the first exam, and don't expect to do well on case reports and the exam because even if you have the answer right, it'll be graded with so much nit-picky ness you'll probably get a few points off a correct answer.
Absolutely awful.  Most students have more real world experience than she does.  The epitome of what's wrong with higher education.  Stay away if at all possible.
Worst professor I've ever had.  Grading criteria absolutely vague.  She doesn't care about her students and is honestly just mean.  Don't take this class if you don't have to

I'm not sure why they hired he (research maybe?). The most arbitrary and confusing grader in the department. Lots of case analyses that are very vague. You really don't learn anything in the course besides buzzwords. I've written lots of good reviews on here, and Paola isn't one of them. If you don't have to take a class with her, PLEASE STAY AWAY!
